Nalfeshnees are huge, corpulent, boar-headed demons that hoard treasures and knowledge alike and form from the souls of avaricious mortals. Few demons understand the inner workings of the [Abyss](/Planes.aspx?ID=13) itself like nalfeshnees, and it's not unusual for a nalfeshnee to see itself as a servitor of the Abyss itself first rather than bow before a demon lord. Some claim stewardship over the fleshy realms that birth new demons, while others guard sites of particular significance deep in the plane's secret reaches. A nalfeshnee's realm in the Abyss can easily surpass the strength and size of the largest mortal kingdoms, for nalfeshnees display a singular gift for managing and manipulating the chaos of the Abyss. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 32 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 [Nalfeshnee](/Monsters.aspx?ID=602) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 68 2.0, [Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad](/Sources.aspx?ID=14) pg. 86 **Perception** +25; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2); [telepathy 100 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) **Skills** [Abyss Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +25, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +25, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +28, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +26, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +24, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +28, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +25 **Str** +8 **Dex** +2 **Con** +8 **Int** +5 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 34 **Fort** +28 **Ref** +22 **Will** +23 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 365 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=272) 15, good 15 **Forfeiture Aversion** A nalfeshnee's greed is such that losing possessions causes them harm. If an item is stolen from a nalfeshnee, the demon takes 3d6+10 [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) damage.
**Greedy Grab** **Trigger** A creature critically fails a weapon Strike against the nalfeshnee; **Effect** The nalfeshnee attempts to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41) the weapon used in the triggering Strike at a –2 circumstance penalty. On a success, the nalfeshnee steals the weapon. --- **Speed** 30 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** jaws +29 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+14 piercing **Melee** claw +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+14 slashing **Divine Innate Spells** DC 34 - **4th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will) - **5th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69), [Illusory Object](/Spells.aspx?ID=160) (at will) - **6th** [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) (at will), [Divine Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=86) (at will) - **Constant (6th)** [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Rituals** DC 34 - **1st** [Abyssal Pact](/Rituals.aspx?ID=21) **Claim Wealth** ([Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Extradimensional](/Traits.aspx?ID=67)) The nalfeshnee steals all unattended items glowing with its Light of Avarice into an extradimensional space. The demon can [Interact](/Actions.aspx?ID=80) to regurgitate any number of these items into their hand or onto the ground. If the demon dies, is affected by a [teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156) effect, or consumes an extradimensional space (such as a [bag of holding](/Equipment.aspx?ID=249)), they vomit up all the items. **Light of Avarice** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Frequency** once per hour; **Effect** Beams of unholy light shoot from the nalfeshnee toward four items within 60 feet. If someone is holding or wearing a targeted item, they can keep it from being affected with a successful DC 34 Reflex save. For 1 minute, the affected items glow in nauseating colors. Any non-demon is [sickened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) and [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) as long as it holds, wears, or touches a glowing item. Recovering from the sickness requires a successful DC 29 Will save instead of a Fortitude save. Ending the sickness this way ends the slowed condition and makes the creature temporarily immune to Light of Avarice for 24 hours. If the creature removes or drops the item, both conditions end immediately but the creature doesn't become immune to Light of Avarice.
Secret Mongers Nalfeshnees covet knowledge as well as material goods, especially if such information can help satisfy the needs and desires of the [Abyss](/Planes.aspx?ID=13). Each nalfeshnee has areas of interest in which they're highly knowledgeable, but before a nalfeshnee reveals a secret, they typically demand a secret of at least equal value in return.
name: Nalfeshnee
